trans-unit.source: How To Change the Drive Letter of the Windows Temporary Disk
trans-unit.target: How To Change the Drive Letter of the Windows Temporary Disk

trans-unit.source: Describes how to remap the temporary disk on a Windows-based VM in Azure
trans-unit.target: Describes how to remap the temporary disk on a Windows-based VM in Azure

trans-unit.source: How to change the drive letter of the Windows temporary disk
trans-unit.target: How to change the drive letter of the Windows temporary disk

trans-unit.source: If you need to use the D drive to store data, follow these instructions to use a different drive for the temporary disk.
trans-unit.target: If you need to use the D drive to store data, follow these instructions to use a different drive for the temporary disk.

trans-unit.source: Never use the temporary disk to store data that you need to keep.
trans-unit.target: Never use the temporary disk to store data that you need to keep.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, you'll need a data disk attached to the virtual machine so you can store the Windows page file (pagefile.sys) during this procedure.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, you'll need a data disk attached to the virtual machine so you can store the Windows page file (pagefile.sys) during this procedure.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>How to attach a data disk to a Windows virtual machine[attach]</linkText><title></title></link> if you don't have one.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>How to attach a data disk to a Windows virtual machine[attach]</linkText><title></title></link> if you don't have one.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to find out what disks are attached, see "Find the disk" in <link><linkText>How to detach a data disk from a Windows virtual machine[detach]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to find out what disks are attached, see "Find the disk" in <link><linkText>How to detach a data disk from a Windows virtual machine[detach]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use an existing data disk on the D drive, make sure you've also uploaded the VHD to the Storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use an existing data disk on the D drive, make sure you've also uploaded the VHD to the Storage account.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see steps 3 and 4 in <link><linkText>Create and upload a Windows Server VHD to Azure[vhd]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see steps 3 and 4 in <link><linkText>Create and upload a Windows Server VHD to Azure[vhd]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you resize a virtual machine and doing that moves the virtual machine to a different host, the temporary disk changes back to the D drive.
trans-unit.target: If you resize a virtual machine and doing that moves the virtual machine to a different host, the temporary disk changes back to the D drive.

trans-unit.source: Change the drive letter
trans-unit.target: Change the drive letter

trans-unit.source: Log on to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>How to log on to a virtual machine running Windows Server[logon]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>How to log on to a virtual machine running Windows Server[logon]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Move pagefile.sys from the D drive to another drive.
trans-unit.target: Move pagefile.sys from the D drive to another drive.

trans-unit.source: Restart the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Restart the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Log on again and change the drive letter from D to E.
trans-unit.target: Log on again and change the drive letter from D to E.

trans-unit.source: From the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>, attach an existing data disk or an empty data disk.
trans-unit.target: From the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>, attach an existing data disk or an empty data disk.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the virtual machine again, initialize the disk, and assign D as the drive letter for the disk you just attached.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the virtual machine again, initialize the disk, and assign D as the drive letter for the disk you just attached.

trans-unit.source: Verify that E is mapped to the temporary disk.
trans-unit.target: Verify that E is mapped to the temporary disk.

trans-unit.source: Move pagefile.sys from the other drive to the E drive.
trans-unit.target: Move pagefile.sys from the other drive to the E drive.

trans-unit.source: Additional resources
trans-unit.target: Additional resources

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to log on to a virtual machine running Windows Server[logon]</linkText><title></title></link>
